game: "Hyvn aetter Hare" (players 2) (equipment { (board (splitCrossings (merge (shift .5 .5 (scale 0.707 (concentric {1 8}))) (square 2) ) ) use:Vertex ) (piece "Hare" P1 "StepToEmpty") (piece "Dog" P2 "StepToEmpty") (hand Each) }) (rules (start { (place "Hare1" (handSite P1) count:1) (place "Dog2" (handSite P2) count:3) }) <Play> )

Hyvn aetter Hare (Described).Play Rules: White moves only when all placed and P2 winning condition

metadata: (info { (description "Hyvn ætter Hare is a blackade game played on Funen Island in Denmark. One player plays as the hare, and the other as three hounds, which attempt to trap the hare. ") (aliases {"Hyvn ætter Hare"}) (useFor "Ruleset/Hyvn aetter Hare (Described)" (rules "Square board, divided into eight equal triangles, and a circle around the square, touching it at the corners, One player plays as the hare, the other player as three hounds. Players take turns placing one of their pieces on the board. When a player has placed all their pieces, they move to an adjacent empty spot. When the hounds block the hare from being able to move, the hounds win. ")) (useFor "Ruleset/Hyvn aetter Hare (Described)" (source "Kristianssen 1937: 30.")) (useFor "Ruleset/Hyvn aetter Hare (Described)" (id "521")) (useFor "Ruleset/Hare Wins (Suggested)" (rules "If the hounds cannot block the hare before the game times out, the hare wins.")) (useFor "Ruleset/Hare Wins (Suggested)" (id "1955")) (source "Michaelsen 2014: 204.") (id "521") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/hunt") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Scandinavia, around 1860.") } ) (graphics { (piece Families {"Abstract" "Themed"}) }) (ai "Hyvn aetter Hare_ai" )
